title: Engineering & Technology Education (2023-24): Exploration of Engineering Technology (8600060)
subject: CTE

document.title: CTE: Technology Education Middle School Curriculum Frameworks

F6FC969985B5408FB5FBE6099861FCE1.description: Complete assigned tasks in a timely and professional manner.

2C022881E77840EA943B1E8274B24BE1.description: Document progress, and provide feedback on work accomplished in a timely manner.

BCF6BA00023A46E49CF440F11B2DD0F8.description: Maintain a positive relationship with other team members.

A60F152C0CB0432187EEEA711A641002.description: Accept responsibility for specific tasks in a given situation.

1C4A278FBBA5481FBA40FD2CDEA5C2FF.description: Successfully work as a member of a team.--The student will be able to:

C602B1AD86CC40CE903890F52EEAB569.description: Use appropriate functions in a presentation software program. (e.g. insert images, duplicate slides, format text)

9E5928AE5F4146F8829BCAFB1FA4A7CF.description: Describe presentation software, the ways it may be used, and appropriate presentation delivery skills.

9150B3032E32418C9DF958C4D90BB8D8.description: Describe a spreadsheet and the ways in which it may be used.

5210A5E1A96D4412BB039D0347DA901B.description: Use appropriate functions in a word processing program. (e.g. format text, insert tables, create bulleted lists)

F24F9DDD105C4A03BADD7BD6973AB118.description: Develop fundamental business productivity software skills.--The students will be able to:

97A5F08FD6FC4DA8A2FBE96B3B652245.description: Adhere to Acceptable Use Policies when accessing the Internet.

8C72656BD3014BBD8465FF6420BA37AC.description: Adhere to cyber safety practices with regard to conducting Internet searches, email, chat rooms, and other social network websites.

ABBE5183E933496FAAEED0BE1910F071.description: Differentiate between viruses and malware, the impact on personal privacy and computer operation, and ways to avoid infection.

C8AF83F4E63D4FC4A5DF51DF915B0FC8.description: Demonstrate an understanding of Internet safety and ethics.--The student will be able to:

61D12A26C41C4B45AA0DFC715AB52F7F.description: Identify and describe various computer input devices (e.g., USB, firewall, parallel and serial, Ethernet, printers, camera).

1383D9FD89604C7FB361C0C64C16B16D.description: Identify and describe the various internal and external components of a computer and their functions (e.g., power supply, hard drive, RAM, mother board, I/O cards/ports, cabling, etc.).

38988D88F90E4EB48754E2C2F186B3E1.description: Demonstrate foundational knowledge and skills associated with common computer peripherals and computer functions.--The student will be able to:

3F5C3050AF8442F498B9E9F901C00F33.description: Present a report on an engineering design problem, concept or issue.

1CA68D20E64F402CAB9D35AB6968AC9A.description: Sketch a graphical or visual solution to an engineering problem.

FDFA55F8059342A3AA80481EE301C81D.description: Create a model of a design solution to an engineering problem.

FF5E4E7FE51A4D7BA6F65A248E4B8B01.description: Describe the experimental method as it is applied to design.

F8A8C4ACC3BB4066AF90648FC8AB2DD8.description: Define terminology associated with engineering products and systems.

F2AF3E45CB6C49388673299229372D11.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the engineering process.--The student will be able to:

1683C1A7E221404893B1CDD784EBDA89.description: Convert measurements using both U.S customary and SI systems of measurement.

9126138CAFAD49529EB23C07922198FC.description: Take and record both U.S customary and SI systems of measurement.

35FA79EDF7F64E25A17816AB0953A029.description: Demonstrate understanding and use of measurement tools and systems.--The student will be able to:

7F0251F68B1A48E6A2526675E4442131.description: Assemble, operate, and identify the parts of mechanical and electrical systems

5A8F0C59C39046658F078D102B80EAB1.description: Read and use system schematics (e.g. electrical and hydraulic circuits).

1B1FDA30AB7145DC9432C83FC60333B2.description: Define scientific quantities that are used in engineering designs (e.g. mass, weight, force, voltage, current, resistance).

D98A2DD12F444659BFD0EED625BFE121.description: Measure and calculate dimensions of parts using metric and customary systems.

1D79D18F932444CD9677E6EE4B73ABBF.description: Demonstrate foundational knowledge and skills associated with the design of engineering systems (e.g. mechanical, fluid, electrical systems).--The student will be able to:

B2AD1E248BF04560A53129FDC207914F.description: Create an isometric sketch or drawing.

0A0E368ABDB84000AE1E700F69719542.description: Create an orthographic sketch or drawing with appropriate layout and dimensions.

F4D2678CF9364E0AB51644D2334FDFEE.description: Explain the concepts of technical sketching and drawing.

288FFB030B7F41A9A665B36AA877FCF4.description: Demonstrate skill in technical sketching and drawing as it relates to engineering design.--The student will be able to:

00A2949A1D494397A8062DC69BBD2144.description: List academic and career programs at the secondary levels in engineering technology.

10E611BFAD34483380E1F214AAF3EADB.description: List occupations, job requirements, and job opportunities in engineering technology

1AA5E12BDB814B81891F607A79B16633.description: Discuss individual interests related to a career.

0420DAF122AC476AB4FC757C0B7EE19B.description: Discuss individual interests, aptitudes, and opportunities as they relate to a career.--The student will be able to:

18596A161216420595EDFA1D7C68D5A3.description: Perform roles in a student personnel system or in a career and technical student organization (CTSO).

E31255060137480299AA9866C40BA35E.description: Exhibit positive human relations and leadership skills.--The student will be able to:

B1485D082D364E7F98B9C6324C3DEE29.description: Identify harmful effects/potential dangers of familiar hazardous substances/devices to people and the environment.

EE9F5F8604B640A28EC5D8074E7156DC.description: Explain fire prevention and safety precautions and practices for extinguishing fires.

4E7A1BCBDA624A3B9C2B351551CC5244.description: Safely use hand tools and power equipment.

AF2F35A8D00C40A695287CC9F08CFA21.description: Select appropriate tools, machines, and equipment to accomplish a given task.

C7C59302838C432D9377AE4C13ECB810.description: Exercise care and respect for all tools, equipment, and materials.

6D2D798325444674A116596D74BFFE82.description: Conduct classroom/laboratory activities and equipment operations in a safe manner.

4AC499867F394EE98EDB73ECAC4266EC.description: Demonstrate good housekeeping at workstations within a classroom/laboratory.

1126CCD2E1EC42CD9AC01C2B325C4A5D.description: Follow classroom/laboratory safety rules and procedures.

DC41648461874F4689BC05DFB067152A.description: Demonstrate proper and safe procedures while working with technological tools, apparatus, equipment, systems, and materials.--The student will be able to:

E27A1F3A19064AD796195A5A6472CCC4.description: Interpret and evaluate the accuracy of the information obtained and determine if it is useful.

9F02453FD1664AC2AB0CEC3FB5E9DF7D.description: Identify trends and monitor potential consequences of technological development.

69B2E5BA3C5240BA864F65E41CEB5DFE.description: Use data collected to analyze and interpret trends in order to identify the positive or negative effects of a technology.

1C7B4F20C649469A8690E85D914B0B07.description: Design and use instruments to gather data.

E0013C4C43A145BBB6AD6E9FD597B6C5.description: Demonstrate the abilities to assess the impact of products and systems.--The student will be able to:

ADE1366157FD45A39514AF3CBA3008FB.description: Operate and maintain systems in order to achieve a given purpose.

AF9137F2FBE94466BB1173827265E89F.description: Use computers and calculators in various applications.

9F7EAA8BBAA34CFCAFE44BDECB4DA732.description: Use tools, materials, and machines safely to diagnose, adjust, and repair systems.

2E70EA8B3DE940BFB2C9D6D7474F296A.description: Use information provided in manuals, protocols, or by experienced people to see and understand how things work.

D773B022A3064EC383C5FAA92918EA33.description: Demonstrate the abilities to use and maintain technological products and systems.--The student will be able to:

43982423B4F94C54A0A74CA01F53E200.description: Make a product or system and document the solution.

668E87D6E3A649B797E8B17D19B16B42.description: Test and evaluate the design in relation to pre-established requirements, such as criteria and constraints, and refine as needed.

8CA2165203DB41BFBEA733D36A260D81.description: Make two-dimensional and three-dimensional representations of the designed solution.

9CB57E90847F47C5BA768E5A1EF085D5.description: Specify criteria and constraints for the design.

A2F77C7B70CD4C348C435C1CFD3F39E5.description: Apply a design process to solve problems in and beyond the laboratory-classroom.

7A42BEE9F6EF4F24AC9DC0C5C31E6562.description: Demonstrate the abilities to apply the design process.--The student will be able to:

400C6C97F4114B43A0BFD0727E735131.description: Identify technological problems that are best solved through experimentation.

06A4066F713C49819A02C7C7416F6686.description: Describe invention as a process of turning ideas and imagination into devices and systems and innovation as the process of modifying an existing product or system to improve it.

2689BEDC39F44FA7B1B9C2C9B8D9F79A.description: Use troubleshooting as a problem-solving method used to identify the cause of a malfunction in a technological system.

D7C8C8C001534EAFB85DF200FF9F89AE.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the role of troubleshooting, research and development, invention and innovation, and experimentation in problem solving.--The student will be able to:

98CAD43EC99645F988DDDAEB721E081D.description: Model, test, evaluate and modify designs to transform ideas into practical solutions.

1D1FF5F9549B4295B8D0031B01C33E58.description: Employ brainstorming as a group problem-solving design process in which each person in the group presents his or her ideas in an open forum.

DFA8E5E2326C4B2FB1BC7D1CC3AAF65D.description: Utilize the design process involving a set of steps, which can be performed in different sequences and repeated as needed.

B60CA8E069A247A3B6FB36F4CFA7A67A.description: Demonstrate an understanding of engineering design.--The student will be able to:

EDBA354F934442E597FEC660174055CA.description: Evaluate criteria and constraints that are requirements for a design.

F8AC3736414242D28D3F402B1B3A4A61.description: Explain why there is no perfect design.

91FB48906B614874878131DDFBE062C4.description: Use design as a creative planning process that leads to useful products and systems.

F877E8EBC5EE48FC8E8D8CEEF99DA102.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the attributes of design.--The student will be able to:

116877A432ED4083A148A2FDB9CA4CFD.description: Investigate how, that in the past, an invention or innovation was not usually developed with the knowledge of science.

40C00C0798D948249D883D816139F219.description: Identify the design and construction of structures for service or convenience evolving from the development of techniques for measurement, controlling systems, and the understanding of spatial relationships.

1BB59B5A02E44143809576B7C8F1E41D.description: Explain how the specialization of function has been at the heart of many technological improvements.

B06C5CE3F52044C49F2F1DD178DA1E10.description: Identify inventions and innovations that have evolved by using slow and methodical processes of tests and refinements.

E92A3181653F49A196A85699367954FB.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the influence of technology on history.--The student will be able to:

8899C194F86F4C28A68DF1D883E309DE.description: Explain how meeting societal expectations is the driving force behind the acceptance and use of products and systems.

C419AB76FFC548FDBA79902405A70E52.description: Understand social and cultural priorities and values that are reflected in technological devices.

DEA15768F47548C68845D5825188D41D.description: Describe changes in society and the creation of new needs and wants caused by the use of inventions and innovations.

3C97C1B07AF449128870F7AFEB779B16.description: Describe the development of technologies that has resulted from the demands, values, and interests of individuals, businesses, industries, and societies.

47824CC4189442DDB00F568CCEA06CFE.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the role of society in the development and use of technology.--The student will be able to:

BE7E6F8692104701851CE48F63761F37.description: Make decisions about the development and use of technologies that put environmental and economic concerns in direct competition with one another.

D13F29B99BEB4B4D83275C972AA5B45A.description: Describe how technologies can be used to repair damage caused by natural disasters and to break down waste from the use of various products and systems.

0464DAA5D6844BC9A3CB514EA42D9199.description: Describe the management of waste produced by technological systems as an important societal issue.

E092C5A868474C97BE8A20211DD16A91.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the effects of technology on the environment.--The student will be able to:

300CF312889F46EA8C64B2114DDA9E8A.description: Identify the economic, political, and cultural issues that are influenced by the development and use of technology.

2909B1213A5A43E7872263C179D2B34C.description: Identify ethical issues associated with the development and use of technology.

41CB6119750C4C52A5945A2EE1C8A451.description: Explain that technology, by itself, is neither good nor bad; but decisions about the use of products and systems can result in desirable or undesirable consequences.

BCDC8473CDF44948AA36BA814C2B3670.description: Identify the ways that use of technology affects humans, including their safety, comfort, choices, and attitudes about technology’s development and use.

275BC0FF537141EDA3425DB5A324BF26.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the cultural, social, economic, and political effects of technology.--The student will be able to:

CAC77B38885648C39276F90789A03143.description: Explain how knowledge gained from other fields of study has a direct effect on the development of technological products and systems.

1A8FDEFA67EA4AA3B68657015CFE5AAC.description: Apply a product, system, or environment developed for one setting in another setting.

984A2BB318534D688245222672AA478F.description: Modify the way technological systems interact with one another.

785B95C484DC4D6FB00F377D1F2E88AD.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the relationships among technologies and the connection between technology and other fields of study.--The student will be able to:

6295E425B1984091A0AEF5BDCF4DCC7A.description: Utilize controls and mechanisms or particular steps that people perform using information about the system that causes systems to change.

86000EEC5A554CB4A99C8BB93446EFF3.description: Perform basic maintenance as the process of inspecting and servicing a product or system on a regular basis in order for it to continue functioning properly, to extend its life, or to upgrade its capability.

9AD2891B64E345A0A0C7A29D9CEB80F3.description: Describe different technologies that involve different sets of processes.

489E581AA3F24AF38F7C2D600B21C89C.description: Compare and contrast trade-offs as a decision process recognizing the need for careful compromises among competing factors.

C9EA61FB63C1412491C4A7F4B1F4C929.description: Compare and contrast requirements or parameters placed on the development of a product or system.

D32846ACF5C248B29BC9C332F6D0F00E.description: Repair malfunctions of any part of a system that may affect the function and quality of the system.

8026D51796EA434D99386E0B3A4FF340.description: Explain how technological systems can be connected to one another.

7A16766BA4D74088AF4E1C3263F8B97E.description: Identify control systems having no feedback path and requiring human intervention, and control systems using feedback.

5690FD9FF7E9486F8818F3257D71F3DA.description: Apply systems thinking, involving considering how every part relates to others.

50D79821815B4E7991EACFB8AE3B1D4C.description: Describe technological systems including input, processes, output, and, at times, feedback.

7AE79BB172E140C78929E397DF1A6350.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the core concepts of technology.--The student will be able to:

CBB5C8F428D54D738D001F2D87B1B33D.description: Demonstrate how corporations can often create demand for a product by bringing it onto the market and advertising it.

A8EB89B32300469CA5B3F51A127712AB.description: Explain how technology is closely linked with creativity, which has resulted in innovation.

9379282A28BD45E998A7E89EAA02C048.description: Describe the development of technology as a human activity that is the result of individual or collective needs and the ability to be creative.

751C330DD4734088AE2E8D6146573C3F.description: Develop new products and systems to solve problems or to help do things that could not be done without the help of technology.

6D2AC6268E7E477CA474AC8965E699AF.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the characteristics and scope of technology.--The student will be able to:
